Spider: Oh, come on you sissies!

He walks up.

Arrow: Spider, don't--

Spi=
der: Quiet, Arrow, you need to learn a few things.

Spider grabs a nice fir=
m grip on Phoenix's arm and vibrates around with electricity crackling thro=
ugh his body. Deemos looks at Arrow, but looks away when Arrow doesn't look=
 back. Spider's grip stayed tight, however. After a few more seconds Spider=
's grip loosens and he is thrown backwards and into a wall. He falls to the=
 floor and twitches, still crackling with electricity.

Deemos: Well, she i=
sn't dead.

Arrow's glare was on Phoenix, he never bothered to check Spider=
's condition...

  ----- Original Message -----
  From: Richard Allen
  To:=
 nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
  Sent: Monday, February 17, 2003 3:08 PM
  Subject=
: Re: Party at nWo base!


  : : Heartbreak : : 

  After seeing Phoenix fa=
ll to her knees, and the odd energy appear HBK takes a step back. 

  Heart=
break: I didn't do it, I swear! I didn't break our toy! 

  : : Wolfenstein=
 : : 

  Wolf sees that something is wrong with Phoenix. What had they done=
?! 

  He pushes past a few nWo members, including Heartbreak. He kneels in=
 front of Phoenix, but he did not touch her. 

  Wolfenstein: Phoenix, it's=
 Wolf. What's wrong with you? Do you need help? 

  Wolfenstein didn't care=
 if he was looking weak in front of the boys. He wanted to help her. He rea=
lly hoped she could see that he meant no harm. 

  The preceding has been p=
aid for by the 

  New World Order 

   "cardhead649 <cardhead649@...=
>" <cardhead649@...> wrote: 

    OOC: You underestimate the inevitab=
le pain threshold of someone who's 
    alternately been a punching bag, ta=
rget practice, and occasionally a 
    sex toy for nine years.  Phoenix has=
 to be taking a huge whale of a 
    beating before she actually screams in=
 pain.  A branding torch 
    doesn't cut it - no pun intended.

    Phoeni=
x::

    The femme doesn't give them the statisfaction of hearing her screa=
m 
    during the branding, although several pained grunts escape her 
    =
gritted teeth.  Phoenix knows how to deal with pain, and she focuses 
    o=
n anything but the burning of her own body to bear the torment in 
    rela=
tive silence.

    Heartbreak's treatment is another matter.  As she lands =
hard on her 
    back, memories surface of the things Clawful did to her, a=
nd Phoenix 
    scrambles away, standing up and backing into a corner.  Tre=
mbling, 
    the femme tries to calm herself - there's no way it could be a=
s bad 
    as before, she rationalizes, since HBK doesn't have claws he cou=
ld 
    spear her to the floor with for starters.  It doesn't work - her mi=
nd 
    keeps superimposing the image of the Rogue berserker over Heartbrea=
k.

    Fear grips her spark compartment with an icy hand.  Seemingly in 
 =
   response to the threat, she feels her unstable mutant spark flare up 
  =
  and send hot tendrils of energy throughout her body.  Even more 
    terr=
ified of her own poorly understood powers than of anything the 
    nWo mig=
ht do to her, she tries to suppress the reaction to no avail.

    The firs=
t external indication that something has gone very wrong is 
    when Phoen=
ix drops to her knees, her arms wrapped around her chest 
    like she's tr=
ying to keep herself from exploding, and that's not far 
    from the truth=
.  Strange energy patterns begin sparking across her 
    frame.  (Think wh=
en the BW characters get energon deep-fried, only 
    the lightning is ora=
nge instead of blue.)

    --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrat=
or" 
    <hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
    > OOC: The sound of Hollywood=
 Narrator typing a post woke up the 
    neighborhood. People called the co=
ps.
    > 
    > BIC:
    > 
    > Arrow had watched the events with indiff=
erence. He had certain laws 
    he abided by. His own twisted laws. One of=
 those was not to question 
    what his fellow bot did. And he hadn't done=
 so, yet. Back in his days 
    with the Radicons, when he had received the=
 lobotomy from the leader 
    of the group, Kracken, he still never questi=
oned any orders or 
    actions. When a comrade made a mistake, he would le=
t it play out, and 
    when an enemy made a mistake, he would take quick a=
ction and harm 
    them quickly and efficiently. Sneaky kills were obvious=
ly not against 
    his law, as he recalls right at the moment how he had r=
ipped the 
    spark from the body of the very child he had cared for in th=
e 
    Chivtrons. He considered it a merciful act.
    > 
    > Deemos, mea=
nwhile, was quite shocked by the events. He thought it 
    was disgusting =
and inappropriate. This was hypocrisy, as Deemos was 
    the one who had s=
liced a team member to bits just for not doing 
    better in battle when D=
eemos led his own group. He briefly recalls 
    Shokaract co-leading his g=
roup and almost becomes glad, for some 
    unknown reason, but then puts h=
is attention back on the events at 
    hand. His optics lit up brightly wh=
en Heartbreak had kissed Phoenix 
    and thrown her down. He knew the prev=
ious events would be 
    commonplace, but he thought this was going too fa=
r. However, this 
    thought came from the guy who had plotted viciously k=
illing his wife 
    and son and had succeeded.
    > 
    > Spider, meanwh=
ile, had the third point of view. He was proud and 
    smiling. He enjoyed=
 everything that went on. He was a rookie bot who 
    was eager for action=
 and any sort of exciting event, no matter what 
    kind.
    > 
    > Mea=
nwhile, a couple of STASIS PODS (I'm sick of ships) fall down on 
    the p=
lanet. What will they become? What sides will they be on? Does 
    anyone =
care?...
    > 
    >   ----- Original Message -----
    >   From: Richard =
Allen
    >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
    >   Sent: Sunday, February 16,=
 2003 5:09 PM
    >   Subject: Party at nWo base!
    > 
    > 
    >   : :=
 Wolfenstein/Razor/Diesel/Heartbreak : :
    > 
    >   Wolfenstein gets ou=
t of the CR chamber. He had been changed to 
    white and black and now sp=
orted the nWo logo. He headed back to the 
    cell block.
    > 
    >   D=
iesel had grown impatient with Hollywood, and got the branding 
    torch h=
imself. He handed it to Razor.
    > 
    >   HBK let the forcefield to the=
 cell down and all nWo members 
    steped in for the party.
    > 
    >  =
 Heartbreak and Diesel took hold of Phoenix's arms from behind, 
    holdin=
g her in place.
    > 
    >   Razor activated the torch, with a evil grin =
on his face. He 
    stepped forward very slowly, surely scaring the femme =
bot.
    > 
    >   Razor: Now my dear, you will belong to us. If you... se=
rvice us 
    you may live. If you refuse, I'll kill you where you stand.
 =
   > 
    >   Razor reached out with the torch and began to ingrave letters=
 
    into the beautiful body of Phoenix. She would surely be screaming 
  =
  from the pain, as the energon flame burnt through her armor, melting 
   =
 pieces of her away. As Razor finished, Phoenix had the nWo logo 
    burne=
d across her chest. She had been branded.
    > 
    >   All the boys start=
ed to laugh at what they had done. All except 
    Wolfenstein, who looked =
away. There were almost tears in his eyes. 
    This wasn't right, she didn=
't deserve this. The physical damage could 
    be repaired but mentaly? Co=
uld anyone recover from an event like this?
    > 
    >   No time had pass=
ed from the branding before Heartbreak took 
    action. He grabbed Phoenix=
 bringing the hot femme to him, roughly. He 
    was grabbing hard, probabl=
y hurting her. He kissed her unwilling 
    form, before throwing her down =
with great force.
    > 
    >   Heartbreak: I'm going to like this!
    > =

    > 
    >   New World Or=
der
